title: Club Blu shooting in Fort Myers: What we know now
content:
Fort Myers police have confirmed two people have died, and at least 16 more were injured, following a Monday morning shooting at Club Blu in Fort Myers.
It is the fifth mass shooting in Lee County since September. Florida Gov. Rick Scott joined community leaders Monday afternoon at a press conference, calling for justice and the public's assistance in getting gun violence to stop.
"It takes everybody working together," Scott said.
The News-Press had teams of journalists at the shooting scene, hospital and victims' homes gathering information about the incident, people involved and the nightclub. As of 6:30 p.m. Monday, here is what we know:
